key_commands.description: List all pods in the namespace to identify failing components and their statuses.
Describe the failing MongoDB pod to inspect container state, mounts, and events.
Fetch container logs from the failing pod to reveal the fatal error indicating an invalid/expired SSL certificate.

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl get pod url-shorten-mongodb-<POD_SUFFIX> -n test-social-network -o wide")
key_commands.description: Get detailed status of the other MongoDB pod to compare health and placement.
key_commands.original_command: exec_shell("kubectl get pod url-shorten-mongodb-77894f9b76-nvj7d -n test-social-network -o wide")

key_commands.description: Describe the healthy MongoDB pod to compare configuration (volumes, TLS secret) with the failing one.

key_commands.command: exec_shell("kubectl get deploy url-shorten-mongodb -n test-social-network -o yaml")
key_commands.description: Retrieve the Deployment spec to confirm TLS secret mounting and configuration that may cause the certificate issue.
